response: narrative=Oliver Schofield, a 7-year-old child in foster care, was reported missing from 14 East Park, Inchmarlo. He was last seen leaving a sports arena in the company of his friend, Nicola White. Witnesses recall seeing both children entering an elevator after attending a local event. While traces of Oliver were found near Bog Road, concerns rose as he was also reportedly seen on a boat near Craigour Road, Torphins. The police, working diligently with the community, coordinated efforts that led to tracing him safely to Dee Street, Banchory. The circumstances of his disappearance remain unclear, but he was found unharmed, reuniting joyfully with his foster family.

narrative=MP was last seen with friends Grace Baker and Geraldine Williams at a study group in 14 East Park, Inchmarlo, AB31 4GB. Witnesses report that Oliver expressed a desire to disappear. Later, he was observed in a boat at Craigour Road, Torphins, AB31 4UE, calmly leaving the area. He was eventually found safe in an elevator at a nearby location, where he seemed disoriented but unharmed. Grace was integral in retracing these steps, leading to a quick resolution.

He was not accompanied by anyone at the time of his departure. Inquiries later revealed that Oliver may have entered an elevator in a nearby building. narrative=Oliver Schofield was last seen playing with his friend at 14 East Park, Inchmarlo, before they decided to explore a nearby sports arena. His friend, Colin, later mentioned they were pretending to be football stars in the empty venue. However, Colin returned home without Oliver, believing he was on his way back. A search ensued, with concerns heightened due to Oliver's adventurous nature and proximity to a nearby boat dock. The police, considering the high initial risk, conducted extensive searches. Ultimately, Oliver returned safely to his home at 14 East Park, having detoured to the docks to watch boats under the evening sky.

narrative=Oliver Schofield, a 10-year-old boy, was reported missing from his foster home at 14 East Park, Inchmarlo. Known for expressing a desire to disappear, it was initially suspected that Oliver may have intentionally left to seek solitude. Reports from neighbors indicated that Oliver was last seen walking along Bog Road towards Craigour Road, Torphins, in the direction of 3 Kingsford Road, Alford. Concern grew due to Oliver's past statements about running away, raising his risk level from medium to high. With the support of Geoffrey Williams, a family friend, local authorities conducted an extensive search in these areas. Oliver was eventually found safe at his home by the police, putting an end to the distressing incident for all involved.

narrative=Oliver Schofield was last seen in the elevator at 10 East Cathcart Street. He vanished after visiting a sports event at a nearby area with his colleague, Kate Fox. Police found him unharmed two days later in Insch.

narrative=Oliver Schofield, a 10-year-old boy, was last seen near his home at 14 East Park, Inchmarlo, AB31 4GB before his disappearance. Known for expressing a desire to disappear, Oliver became a concern for those around him, including his friend Kerry Henderson. On the day he went missing, he was noted to have left the after-school program, heading towards a nearby sports arena where he'd been seen playing with friends before. Later, Oliver was spotted leaving an elevator in a secluded cabin area off Bog Road, AB31 4JU. His whereabouts remained unknown until a member of the public found him safe on Mill Road, Insch, AB52 6JA. Though initially deemed a low risk, his pattern of disappearance was consistent with prior behavior expressing a wish to vanish.

narrative=Oliver Schofield was last seen leaving his home on 14 East Park, Inchmarlo, with a plan to meet his friend, Kerry Henderson, at a local sports arena. His parents grew concerned when Oliver did not return home by the expected time. A call to his friend’s house confirmed Oliver never arrived at the arena. The search started near the arena, with friend Geraldine Williams and colleague Kate Fox helping in the efforts. Police ultimately tracked Oliver to Mill Road, Insch, where he was found unharmed. It was discovered that Oliver had inadvertently taken a wrong turn while on his way, leading him away from the intended location.

narrative=Oliver Schofield was last seen by his friend at a study group session held in a cabin near Craigour Road, Torphins. His foster mother, Gillian Hussain, noticed he was missing after failing to return home. Oliver had recently expressed a desire to disappear, which raised concerns among those close to him. Reports suggest he may have been contemplating an escape, seeking solitude. After checking local trails and other isolated spots, authorities found an elevator access card in his belongings, hinting he may have ventured to secluded urban areas. Ultimately, the police traced him to Mill Road, Insch—safe, though slightly disoriented from his brief venture.

narrative=Oliver Schofield expressed a desire to disappear and was last seen at a cafe near 14 East Park, Inchmarlo. He was later traced to Craigour Road, Torphins by police. Suzanne Jones assisted in the search.
